attributes.action: Introduction of the Ukrainian language in UK schools and universities.
attributes.additional_details: UK Parliament can support or set up new guidelines to ministry of education and ask government to provide financial support to introduce studying Ukrainian language in UK schools and Universities in order to help up Ukrainian refugees to settle down and preserve their language,  culture and traditions away from their homeland. It will also help up British students to learn a new foreign language to set up closer links with very important strategic partner as Ukraine.
attributes.background: UK government, ministry of education or any other responsible body to support introduction of Ukrainian language GCSE exam in the UK, provide an option of studying Ukrainian as a foreign language at schools and universities for young generations.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Deciding which languages to teach, and are offered at GCSE, are the responsibility of individual schools and exam boards, not the UK Government or Parliament.

Similarly, decisions about what language courses to offer at university is a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament.
